intro: Dendranthema zawadzkii var. coreanum, commonly known as Korean chamomile, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has mild aromatic properties. The leaves and flowers are used in traditional medicine for their purported calming and anti-inflammatory effects.
